title: Keep Our Library Public!
short: We believe that all of the Blasco Erie County Public Library belongs to the public!
description: Keep Our Library Public (KOLP) has filed a legal complaint in the Erie County Court of Common Pleas to prevent 3200 square feet of Blasco Erie County Public Library in Erie County, PA from being leased to a tax-exempt, private, religious university. Please help us fund our legal fight!  Donations given through FundLibraries.org are tax deductible.

title: Help Support Read Freely Alabama
short: Our state-wide grassroots group needs your help to fight back against anti-library extremism and censorship
description: Your generous donations go to fund our advocacy and outreach events, legislative initiatives, supplies, and technology/software to allow us to continue the fight against extremism in Alabama.

title: Books & Blooms Community Garden
short: Help us turn a vacant lot next to the library into a community garden—complete with outdoor reading nooks and a seed-swap kiosk.
description: We’re combining nature and literature! With your support we’ll:• Build raised beds and benches• Install weather-proof shelves stocked with donated titles• Host bi-weekly garden storytimes and seed swapsAll funds go toward materials, plants, and a part-time garden coordinator. Let’s grow community, one book at a time!

title: Books Not Bans: Protect Student Access
short: Help us push back against local censorship efforts and fund a student-led awareness campaign at our public high schools.
description: Across our district, students are seeing more books challenged or removed from school libraries—often without transparency or due process. This campaign will fund a student-designed outreach initiative to educate peers, parents, and school board members about the value of intellectual freedom and inclusive library collections. Funds raised will support printing materials, organizing events, and building an online hub to mobilize support.

title: Safe Shelves: Protecting LGBTQ+ Books in Small Town Libraries
short: Help us defend inclusive collections under threat in conservative communities by funding locked display cases and staff training.
description:
In dozens of small-town libraries across the Midwest, books by and about LGBTQ+ people are being removed from shelves, vandalized, or hidden due to local pressure. Safe Shelves is a rapid-response project to help library staff keep these books accessible and protected.

Your donation will fund clear locking display cases, signage affirming the right to read, and staff training materials on patron privacy and intellectual freedom. We’re starting with three libraries in Iowa and Nebraska—but your support can help expand this effort nationally.

Books should never be silenced. Stand with us.

title: Project Library Polling Initiative
short: Help us raise the funds needed to conduct comprehensive polling on our upcoming library funding ballot measure.
description: Libraries are at the heart of every community, but we need solid data to ensure voters understand the full impact of our proposed ballot initiative. Your contribution will underwrite a professional polling firm to survey voters across the county—identifying key messages, measuring support levels, and pinpointing potential concerns. With clear, actionable insights in hand, our campaign can tailor outreach to build the broadest coalition in favor of stable, long-term library funding.

title: Storytime on Wheels
short: Help us convert a vintage food truck into a pop-up picture-book library that can roll into parks and community events all summer long.
description:
Why a mobile storytime?  

Many families in East Portland live miles from a branch library. Storytime on Wheels brings books, puppets, and lively read-alouds right to them. Your donation funds:  
• Custom shelving and book bins  
• A wheelchair-accessible ramp  
• Fuel and driver stipend through Labor Day  

Every $25 outfits the truck with a brand-new hardcover. Let’s put 300 stories on the street!
